009package imagingbook.pub.lucaskanade;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.lib.util.ParameterBundle;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
019import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.Translation2D;
020
021
022/**
023 * This is the common super-class for different variants of the Lucas-Kanade
024 * matcher.
025 *  @author Wilhelm Burger
026 *  @version 2019/01/03
027 */
028public abstract class LucasKanadeMatcher {
029
030        /**
031         * Default parameters for the containing class and its sub-classes; 
032         * a (usually modified) instance of this class is passed to the constructor 
033         * of a non-abstract sub-class.
034         */
035        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
036                /** Convergence limit */
037                public double tolerance = 0.00001;
038                /** Maximum number of iterations */
039                public int maxIterations = 100;
040                /** Set true to output debug information */
041                public boolean debug = false;
042                /** Set true to display the steepest-descent images */
043                public boolean showSteepestDescentImages = false;
044                /** Set true to display the Hessian matrices */
045                public boolean showHessians = false;
046        }
047        
048        final FloatProcessor I;                 // search image
049        final FloatProcessor R;                 // reference image
050        final Parameters params;                // parameter object
051        
052        final int wR, hR;                               // width/height of R
053        final double xc, yc;                    // center (origin) of R
054        
055        int iteration = -1;
056        
057        /**
058         * Creates a new Lucas-Kanade-type matcher.
059         * @param I the search image (of type {@link FloatProcessor}).
060         * @param R the reference image (of type {@link FloatProcessor})
061         * @param params a parameter object of type  {@link LucasKanadeMatcher.Parameters}.
062         */
063        protected LucasKanadeMatcher(FloatProcessor I, FloatProcessor R, Parameters params) {
064                this.I = I;     // search image
065                this.R = R;     // reference image
066                this.params = params;
067                wR = R.getWidth();
068                hR = R.getHeight();
069                xc = 0.5 * (wR - 1);
070                yc = 0.5 * (hR - 1);
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Calculates the transformation that maps the reference image {@code R} (centered
075         * around the origin) to the given quad Q.
076         * @param Q an arbitrary quad (should be inside the search image I);
077         * @return the transformation from {@code R}'s bounding rectangle to {@code Q}.
078         */
079        public ProjectiveMapping2D getReferenceMappingTo(Pnt2d[] Q) {
080                Pnt2d[] Rpts = getReferencePoints();
081                return ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(Rpts, Q);
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * @return the corner points of the bounding rectangle of R, centered at the origin.
086         */
087        public Pnt2d[] getReferencePoints() {
088                double xmin = -xc;
089                double xmax = -xc + wR - 1;
090                double ymin = -yc;
091                double ymax = -yc + hR - 1;
092                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[4];
093                pts[0] = PntDouble.from(xmin, ymin);
094                pts[1] = PntDouble.from(xmax, ymin);
095                pts[2] = PntDouble.from(xmax, ymax);
096                pts[3] = PntDouble.from(xmin, ymax);
097                return pts;
098        }
099        
100        
101        /**
102         * Performs the full optimization on the given image pair (I, R).
103         * @param Tinit the transformation from the reference image R to
104         * the initial search patch, assuming that R is centered at the coordinate
105         * origin!
106         * @return the transformation to the best-matching patch in the search image I
107         * (again assuming that R is centered at the coordinate origin) or null if
108         * no match was found.
109         */
110        public ProjectiveMapping2D getMatch(ProjectiveMapping2D Tinit) {
111//              initializeMatch(Tinit);                 // to be implemented by sub-classes
112                // ProjectiveMappingP Tp = Tinit.duplicate();
113                ProjectiveMapping2D Tp = Tinit;
114                do {
115                        Tp = iterateOnce(Tp);           // to be implemented by sub-classes
116                } while (Tp != null && !hasConverged() && getIteration() < params.maxIterations);
117                return Tp;
118        }
119        
120        
121        /**
122         * Performs a single matching iteration on the given image pair (I, R).
123         * 
124         * @param Tp the warp transformation from the reference image R to
125         * the initial search patch, assuming that R is centered at the coordinate
126         * origin! 
127         * @return a new warp transformation (again assuming that R is centered at 
128         * the coordinate origin) or null if the iteration was unsuccessful.
129         */
130        public abstract ProjectiveMapping2D iterateOnce(ProjectiveMapping2D Tp);
131        
132        
133        /**
134         * Checks if the matcher has converged.
135         * @return true if minimization criteria have been reached.
136         */
137        public abstract boolean hasConverged();
138        
139        /**
140         * Measures the RMS intensity difference between the reference image R and the 
141         * patch in the search image I defined by the current warp Tp.
142         * @return the RMS error under the current warp
143         */
144        public abstract double getRmsError();           
145        
146        public int getIteration() {
147                return iteration;
148        }
149        
150        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
151        
152        protected FloatProcessor gradientX(FloatProcessor fp) {
153                // Sobel-kernel for x-derivatives:
154            final float[] Hx = Matrix.multiply(1f/8, new float[] {
155                                -1, 0, 1,
156                            -2, 0, 2,
157                            -1, 0, 1
158                            });
159            FloatProcessor fpX = (FloatProcessor) fp.duplicate();
160            fpX.convolve(Hx, 3, 3);
161            return fpX;
162        }
163        
164        protected FloatProcessor gradientY(FloatProcessor fp) {
165                // Sobel-kernel for y-derivatives:
166                final float[] Hy = Matrix.multiply(1f/8, new float[] {
167                                                -1, -2, -1,
168                                                 0,  0,  0,
169                                                 1,  2,  1
170                                                 });
171            FloatProcessor fpY = (FloatProcessor) fp.duplicate();
172            fpY.convolve(Hy, 3, 3);
173            return fpY;
174        }
175        
176        // ------------------------- utility methods --------------------------
177        
178        /* We must be precise about the corner points of a rectangle:
179         * If rectangle r = <u, v, w, h>, all integer values, then the first
180         * top-left corner point (u, v) corresponds to the center of pixel
181         * (u, v). The rectangle covers w pixels horizontally, i.e., 
182         * pixel 0 = (u,v), 1 = (u+1,v), ..., w-1 = (u+w-1,v).
183         * Thus ROIs must have width/height > 1!
184         */
185        
186//      @Deprecated
187//      private Point[] getPoints(Rectangle2D r) {      // does -1 matter? YES!!! CORRECT!
188//              IJ.log("getpoints1:  r = " + r.toString());
189//              double x = r.getX();
190//              double y = r.getY();
191//              double w = r.getWidth();
192//              double h = r.getHeight();
193//              Point[] pts = new Point[4];
194//              pts[0] = new Point.Double(x, y);
195//              pts[1] = new Point.Double(x + w - 1, y);
196//              pts[2] = new Point.Double(x + w - 1, y + h - 1);
197//              pts[3] = new Point.Double(x, y + h - 1);
198//              //IJ.log("getpoints1:  p1-4 = " + pts[0] + ", " + pts[1] + ", " + pts[2] + ", " + pts[3]);
199//              return pts;
200//      }
201        
202        protected void showSteepestDescentImages(double[][][] S) {      // S[u][v][n]
203                String titlePrefix = "sd";
204                int w = S.length;
205                int h = S[0].length;
206                int n = S[0][0].length;
207                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
208                        FloatProcessor sdip = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
209                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
210                                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
211                                        sdip.setf(u, v, (float) S[u][v][i]);
212                                }
213                        }
214                        (new ImagePlus(titlePrefix + i, sdip)).show();
215                }
216        }
217        
218        // ported from ProjectiveMapping2D --------------------------------
219        
220        public double[] getParameters(ProjectiveMapping2D map) {
221                double[][] A = map.getTransformationMatrix();
222                return new double[] {
223                                A[0][0]-1, A[0][1], A[1][0], A[1][1]-1, A[2][0], A[2][1], A[0][2], A[1][2]};
224                //return new double[] { a00 - 1, a01, a10, a11 - 1, a20, a21, a02, a12 };
225        }
226        
227        public ProjectiveMapping2D toProjectiveMap(double[] param) {
228                if (param.length < 8) {
229                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Affine mapping requires 8 parameters");
230                }
231                return new ProjectiveMapping2D(
232                                param[0] + 1,   param[1],        param[6],
233                                param[2],       param[3] + 1,    param[7],
234                                param[4],       param[5]             );
235        }
236        
237        // ---------------------
238        
239        public double[] getParameters(AffineMapping2D map) {
240                double[][] A = map.getTransformationMatrix();
241                return new double[] { 
242                                A[0][0] - 1, A[0][1], A[1][0], A[1][1]-1, A[0][2], A[1][2]};
243                //return new double[] { a00 - 1, a01, a10, a11 - 1, a02, a12 };
244        }
245        
246        public AffineMapping2D toAffineMap(double[] param) {
247                if (param.length < 6) {
248                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Affine mapping requires 6 parameters");
249                }
250                return new AffineMapping2D(
251                                param[0] + 1, param[1],     param[4],
252                                param[2],     param[3] + 1, param[5]);
253        }
254        
255        // --------------------
256        
257        public double[] getParameters(Translation2D map) {
258                double[][] A = map.getTransformationMatrix();
259//              double[] p = new double[] {a02, a12};
260                return new double[] {A[0][2], A[1][2]};
261        }
262        
263        public Translation2D toTranslation(double[] p) {
264                if (p.length < 2) {
265                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Translation requires 2 parameters");
266                }
267                return new Translation2D(p[0], p[1]);
268        }
269
270}
